text: I like to review restaurants based mostly on their food quality. The decor isn't that important, service should be adequate, it should be clean and a have a working restroom which FB did not have. So I have to give Farm Basket 2 stars. We had chicken fingers, farm fries, regular fries, coleslaw, potato salad and fried chicken. The farm fries were the highight because how can you go wrong with gravy over fries. The rest of the food was average to below. The chicken fingers were, well I've had better frozen from the supermarket. The regular fries were crispy but greasy, time for an oil change maybe. The fried chicken was okay but nothing special. The sides were also okay but not worth the drive. A couple of pluses was the service was quick even on a busy Friday night and he staff was very friendly. Next time we want chicken fingers we'll head to our local bowling ally's snack bar.

I've been going to this place since I moved here 10 years ago. I still love some of the items on the menu but a few years ago they changed their chicken fingers, and they are definitely not as good as it use to be which makes me sad. But the service is always quick and they are usually always nice.

My kids love their crispy chicken  good portions on that.. not bad on price either..
Just discovered it while waiting on my car alram to get fixed next door

Great lunch and price is good even without a coupon. Order ahead and you'll be good, it takes awhile to make it but it's fresh so I can't complain. The folks that work there are nice and seem like they actually care about your order. I'll be back!
Not much to say when every time I go there the food is great. Try it you'll love it. Ask for Steve the owner he's on top of everything and a nice guy

The last remaining Farm Basket in Las Vegas. SO SAD about that. FB is a unique but very delicious fast food shop that specalizes in chicken and turkey items. Best on their menu is the Great Gobbler sandwich, a deep fried half turkey breast sandwich with Miracle Whip.There's something so great about this! Perhaps that it's cooked to order and fresh helps. It could also be their delish fries (if they are cooked in turkey fat/oil it explains ALOT of why they are so great) that are served with a Lawry's seasoning salt. Simple, but oh-so good.

For me, it's on the other side town, but when i'm in the area, I have to get some. When this one closes, it will be a very sad day for me.
Clucketos and fries are good.  Im not a fan of chicken on the bone, so I cant comment on the chicken.   This location is the only one left in town.  Miss the original orange glazed rolls.

Bought a family 12 piece.  Very disappointed. The chicken was old and nothing but small chicken thighs. I will never come back.Defintly not worth the 25.00 Albertsons chicken taste way better than this for 8.99 or even KFC.

Love the Gobbler Sandwich. It's been a favorite since I was a kid. Back in town for a visit and so happy I can stop in for a super tasty sandwich and best fries. The chicken fingers and cluck e tos are great as well. Just had their home made chicken soup for the first time. Another hit. Carrot cake for dessert  score again. 

Service is always excellent whether ordering inside at the counter or drive thru. 

Inside the restaurant is clean as is the restroom outside in the back. 

Farm Basket never disappoints.

Oh sorry for no pic ... I couldn't wait to devour the goods.
The food was just OK nothing to write home about...I think KFC is far better chicken than this food ..no bueno...

Love Sundays for the Cluck e' tos ($4.99) - Something worth noting is that these are BOGO every Sunday!   The Gobbler turkey sandwich is awesome, served with a generous amount of cranberry sauce!  I almost hate to give this establishment such a great review for fear that they'll get TOO busy!  Love this chicken establishment.  The only suggestion - They need to do waffles with their fierce chicken!
If you don't like Farm Basket we cant hang out! Place has been amazing since the 70's....dont sleep!
Amazing classic food! Last location left in Vegas... People are so nice and the gobbler is amazing!

Get a turkey steak dinner with fries instead of coleslaw. Cluckers are also amazing, gobblers are amazing. Get them with an individual side of gravy and dip your sandwiches. Diet skinny chicken is also 30% less fat and cholesterol if you're watching your weight.  Ive been eating it since the womb it will never get old.

Yum!  I went to an event that Farm Basket catered, and got to try a clucker sandwich (a sub roll with fried chicken, mayonnaise, and cranberry sauce).  I enjoyed it!  The fries were good too.  If you're craving fried chicken, then this is a good place to get it.

Like other reviewers, I too have an emotional connection with this place, been coming here for the last 25+ years! If you want comfort food that's fast and delicious, give this place a try...hard to beat the clucker or gobbler sandwiches.. and the mashed potatoes & gravy are amazing!

This place used to be a Las Vegas treasure.  In the the 30 years I've lived here, it's been my go-to place for chicken fingers or a quick turkey and mashed meal.  I'm not sure if they've undergone an ownership change or what, but the food is just simply average or below average now.  The chicken fingers now taste as if they're purchased frozen and re-fried and the turkey and gravy are totally bland.  The last two times I've eaten there, I thought maybe it was just a bad day for the cook.  Went by last night and it wasn't great again.  Unfortunately, looks like they'll be losing a very long term customer.  Sad but true.

This place has the BEST turkey Gobbler Sandwiches. The fries are always piping hot and nice & salty. The most stand out thing about Farm Basket is how fast they are at delivering your food....and it's always hot!

WAAAAY back in the 1970s, our family began eating here, and always enjoyed it.  We ate the traditional fried chicken and the "cluck-e-tos" (chicken taquitos/flautas/rolled tacos).  What with one thing and another, we drifted away.

A couple of months ago, I was driving down that stretch of West Charleston near Jones, and saw the Farm Basket sign.  (I thought they had gone out of business.)  Still around, still that one small building, and, surprisingly, the same very good chicken.  Of course, in the interest of nostalgia, I had to order more cluck-e-tos ... still as good as I remember then.  The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the roll.  It's a huge thing, which in itself is not bad, but they drizzle it with some kind of sweet syrup, which is not what I want when I want bread with my chicken.  Otherwise ... yeah, I'll be back.
-- -- -- -- --
On the Nighthawk 100-point scale: 82.

Giblet gravy! Giblet gravy! Giblet gravy.  Yes they have it an it is yummy.  There chicken is very good for fast food but I wouldn't suggest anything else, although I did not have the turkey.  I recomend it, especially compared to all of the other crap in the fast food world.

It was my first time here and I was pleasantly surprised. The food was really good (I had the 2 piece chicken meal), and those sweet rolls are just the icing on the cake !!! YUM!!!!! I will definitely be back to try other items.
I really like this place. The chicken has a very nice flavor. The inside smells nice. I found out from a employee that if you follow them on facebook you can get good deals.
I only wish the one the Trop. never left us. The Great Gobbler and the Cluckitos are still as good as I remember them.

A historical landmark for Las Vegas of the must have food stop! Absolutely love the gobbler sandwich, amazing fries and clucktioes. Though their prices have risen it is still worth the price and should have more farm baskets around town especially by my house.

Having lived in Vegas for a long time, this is an old high school favorite. 

Think of it like the greasy pizza place or Philly cheese steak you used to have on a Friday night with a bunch of your friends long before you could start drinking legally-but it's fried food instead!

I would have to say after all these years, the consistency has never changed. My typical meal consists of a gobbler sandwich, large fries and lemonade. The clucker sandwich is also good. 

You won't find any mayo here for your sandwich, it's miracle whip only or go home. My gobbler always comes with cranberry sauce as well. Personally, I ask for two cranberries hold the whip just so I can smother the juicy turkey breast in the cranberry delight. It's like deep frying a chunk of breast from Thanksgiving leftovers and loading it on soft bread.

And now for the fries..... Sometimes I drive through just to get three or four servings, and nothing more. Farm basket fries taste like they've been deep-fried chicken fat. They are crispy on the outside and tender on the inside with just enough seasoning salt (and I wouldn't doubt if it has MSG) to make you keep going back for more.

The dining room is no-frills and never has been. Neither is the restroom, that is, if it's even open in the back like used to be. There are even some of the sodas that they still serve in cans. 

For dessert, may I suggest the cream cheese carrot cake. It's moist and a healthy serving! 

This might not be the place for some of the newbies in town because it's not diet food, and not fancy. But to those of us who've been in Las Vegas for years , it still remains an old favorite!
Had Chicken Fingers with Fries. I felt like I was eating grease on grease on grease. I should've went to Raising Canes, end of story.

If you're a vegas native, you know Farm Basket. I love that they still have their old school barnyard ambience. Miss the wood planks in the drive through, that were apparently washed away by a typical vegas flood. The clucketoes are my go-to, always get extra salsa!! Crispy, but not "break your teeth" crispy. And two words, FARM FRIES. Deliciously seasoned French fries topped with cheese, gravy, and chicken pieces. Carb overload fosho. I wish I could review more items on the menu, but in my 25 years in Vegas, these are the only things I've ever ordered. It's like Baskin Robbins, there's 31 flavors, but you always go for your vanilla, whatever that may be. I love that this spot is still standing, one of the few family/small businesses in vegas that has survived longer than I've been alive. Whether you're new to vegas or you're a local who has never tried (HOW DARE YOU), give this place a shot. Don't let appearances deceive you, their appearance is part of what makes them great and OG.

My husband and I have been eating here for years and years. Back when they had one on East DI. Today will be the last time we eat here. To change your menu after decades in business is just ridiculous. We live in Henderson and would drive all the way to W Charleston for the chicken fingers and turkey dinner. Not anymore. I understand "the owners", as the girl on the phone said, changed the chicken from frozen to cooked at the restaurant. Well it's not cooked well. Doesn't taste the same. Please tell me where I can get the frozen ones from now on. We put up with your unfriendly staff and somewhat overpriced food because it was delicious, but no more. Goodbye Farm Basket. This customer is gone forever.

Hey, this isn't a place you take your date to without prior warning.  Looks pretty plain and not so special when you arrive.  But very clean, and the staff give every appearance of liking to work there and wanting you to like the food.  Just an impression.  

Then you bite into a piece of their chicken.  We got the crispy.  But I suspect the same of all their chicken -- WOW.  Jenna was our order taker.  She's a kick.  This is the thing you can tell she loves to do.  And when we left with our takeout - we hadn't taken a bite yet - we called out, "thank you", and every single one of the staff all turned to us with a big grin.

So you can bet what the chicken tasted like when we got home.  Sunday night is movie night for us.  We made up our plates and sat down to watch our movie.  But quickly we stopped the movie to talk about how spectacular the chicken was.   Now I can tell you, this reminds me of the saying, 'chicken the way my mama used to make it'.

Sunday night dinner, fried chicken from mama -- go hit up Farm Basket.

Oh, by the way: workers behave the way they're treated.  Jenna told us a story about how her boss challenged the staff for an exceptional need; and it's obvious from her story that the boss here is pretty exceptional himself.

You can only get it in Vegas, and there's only one left in the whole city! I remember getting Cluck e' tos when I was knee high to a grass hopper. Two for one on Thursdays is one of the best deals around. Don't forget your side of gravey, hahaa! I put that sh** on everything. Worth the drive through the drive thru after a night of drinking, for sure. The Gobbler is just as amazing to me as Capriotti's Bobbie, but the Gobbler is deep fried! The Clucker is delicious, too. I'm glad I ate my Cluck e' tos before reviewing, or I'd be in a sad state!!! Even heard a kid talking to his coworkers, at K Mart today, asking them if they ever had been. Of course, I had to say something, while walking by. I heard them say they'd go on the lunch break. Too cute. I love my Farm Basket! Only in Vegas, and one of the last of the Vegas Originals.

ARE YOU KIDDING ???  I kept hearing about this place though with mixed reviews so I took a chance .i went in ordered , friendly service had the Cluckeetos and a 3 piece chicken dinner , in 30 seconds it was done . So everything was pre made . Tasted less than any fast food chain  except at twice the price . Popeyes has them beat hands down. Now I know why there were many of these around years ago and only one survived . I guess people like going because it's been there so long. Don't waste your time or money

Did not go inside ! Went through the drive thru!! Chicken was good I would say like any other chicken place ! The Family Fries with gravy and cheese was awesome!! Coleslaw was ok ! Mash potatoes were fine !!

Like the old school building ! Service was fine and would go back !! Finally checking this one off my list !

This place would get 5 stars if their fried chicken was better. But you don't come here for the fried chicken. You come for the sandwiches (great gobbler or super clucker) or the Cluck-e-tos!    They simply have a taste all their own. Iced tea is very good here as well. 

I hope the last remaning location never closes. I always stop by when I am in the neighborhood.

Horrible! I have both KFC, and Church's Chicken in my area. Yet, I chose Farm Basket (which is out of the way)because they USUALLY trump the other restaurants in taste. Not this time! They were running a dark meat special (8pcs/$7.99). I got home to see why it was on special. It was probably 4-5 days old. There's nothing worse than getting home after a long day and sitting down to a horrible dinner! You really should be embarrassed about the quality of this food, Farm Basket!

Wow, totally not like how I remembered this chicken tasting. I remember it tasting really good with an assortment of spices that was perfectly blended and balanced so full of flavor that was unique to Farm Basket. But having moved away from this side of town I haven't been there since the early 90's. So finding myself in the neighborhood I decided to grab a 15 piece meal. It came with rolls, gravy, and mashed potato. Now the chicken was cooked perfectly soft & tender, but the taste was not there. It was bland. So was the gravy. A total disappointment. I felt really bad for my family members who never tried it before because I had built up the taste to everyone. I will never be back to eat here again. I guess the old saying that you can't go back again is true. At least it is for me and the Farm Basket of the early 90's. I rarely give bad reviews. When I do, it means it was really disappointing.

In the words of Drake, the Farm Fries here "be hittin' all the spots that you ain't even know was there." In theory, anyway. Fries plus chicken gravy (with pieces of fried chicken) and shredded cheese, in a giant portion, for $4.  Except the gravy could be better, and the cheese is cheap and rendered almost tasteless. But if you can overlook the fact that the product could be better, it's excellent for drowning your sorrows in on a bad day.

That being said, the chicken is largely regarded as mediocre and I ordered the clucketos and was underwhelmed as well- crispy, topped with lettuce and cheese, served with a side of salsa, but stuffed with chicken ground so finely as to make me suspicious of it's quality. 

And "The Gobbler" is basically a dry-as-ashes fried piece of poultry (you can't even taste that it's turkey), about on par in size and appearance with the "Chicken Littles" or "Snackers" at KFC, served with packets of cranberry and Miracle Whip. Not only is the sandwich sad, small, and disgusting, but it's not worth more than a buck or two. And whoever created Miracle Whip should be burned at the stake.

As others have said, order was ready in a flat two minutes- which is remarkable. Frankly I'm surprised the clucketos were so crisp because I can't figure out how they cooked them so fast. But those fries, man... it's actually kind of a blessing they're not better. I mean unless your life goal is to weigh four hundred pounds.

Simple food that just hits the spot!

I must have passed this place for years before stopping in one night to finally try it. The clucker sandwich has become one of my favorite cheat meals ever. It's a fried chicken breast sandwich that comes with cranberry sauce on the side & miracle whip (I skip the miracle whip but my man loves it). The bread it comes on is buttered! I also need to mention the fries which are heavenly. Not sure what they do to give them the perfect crispy bite but I don't even need ketchup on them they're so good! 

We've also tried the sweet, orange rolls that are crazy good and then the cluck e' tos!!! Three rolled chicken tacos with cheese, lettuce & salsa. Everything is great here and if you haven't tried them you definitely should. 

Cons ~ 

Located in a sketchy part of town (use the drive-thru if you get scared)
Very small inside & sometimes runs out of seating
Decor is meh
Customer service is a hit & miss 

With all that said I genuinely enjoy the food & always look forward to eating here!

Finally got a chance to stop by tonight and try the new chicken fingers and I got to say they were AMAZING! I was pretty upset you changed the recipe but you did it right! Our clucker and fries tasted better than any other time we have gone before and I've been going there for over 20 years. Hopefully you do build one in Summerlin.

This is a genuine, Las Vegas original. They use to have several across town, but now limited to this location. Which I don't have a problem traveling to, at all! I love the Gobbler sandwich. It's a turkey breast, with mayo and some cranberry sauce. Whenever I'm in the area, I have to make a stop here. It's a must! Now, to get started with the fries. Hands-down my favorite fries in the world. They're crisp and seasoned perfectly. I don't even use ketchup, or any dipping sauce for that matter. The chicken tenders here are just as to be expected, tasty. I remember coming here as a child after football practice, with my dad. Great memories, along with great food, makes for the best experience. I relive it each time I eat here :) I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a unique taste of fried food. I love farm basket...

Honestly, one of my favorite places to go in Las Vegas. I'm not sure if it's because I used to drive thru here on my way home from school way back in the day or it's because their food was and still is delicious. 

I always go for the gobbler special which is always cooked perfectly with a side of their awesomely seasoned fries and a cold beverage. 

This will always be a Las Vegas staple for me.
Love this place , been here forever! Get the Gobbler.,, Thanksgiving in a sandwich.. Cranberry!! Those fries... There's only one location on Charleston and Jones- make sure to stop by!

This a classic chicken joint, includes regular fried chicken that is quite good and the fries themselves aren't anything special but the seasoning they use makes them very addictive. They also have a some really good chicken and turkey sandwiches as well as chicken taquitos called clucketos. All in all a pretty solid chicken spot.
Best chicken fingers EVER! And their fries rock too! Went here a million times when I was in school!

It's a fast food restaurant with a drive thru that is similar to KFC or Popeyes. The difference with Farm Basket is that they also serve turkey, including the turkey gobbler sandwich. 

We ordered the 9 piece meal with 3 mashed potatoes and gravy, 3 rolls, and 3 coleslaw. I actually liked the way the side were served. The side dishes were individually portioned so each person had their own, as opposed to one large container. 

The chicken was a bit bland; I prefer spicy chicken or well seasoned chicken. The potatoes had plenty of gravy on them. The coleslaw was good and had a different seasoning that I couldn't quite pinpoint, but it made it better. 

Overall, the food wasn't spectacular, but it was good. It would rank 3rd if compared to Popeyes (1) or KFC (2). If we go back I'll try the turkey gobbler sandwich and re-review.

I recently tried the 12 piece box, mashed potatoes with gravy, coleslaw and rolls. The chicken is extremely moist and very meaty. The gravy was thick with chicken and excellent over the potatoes. The coleslaw was tangy and crisp. The meal was like KFC with extra character. 
The best part however was the ambiance. I felt like I had gone back in time and come upon a part of Las Vegas history. The Farm Basket should be in the Las Vegas historic Registry.

Farm Basket is one of those great local fast food restaurants that you typically only see in Los Angeles. It's Las Vegas only as far as I know and a hidden gem. They serve up delicious chicken/turkey fast food dishes. My long time favorite has been the Cluckitos, tacquitos stuffed with seasoned chicken, covered with a generous helping of lettuce, salsa, and cheese. Their turkey sandwiches are delicious too, with a side of jelly for the "authentic" Thanksgiving experience. Finally the fries are deliciously crisp and sprinkled with a unique flavored salt. If you're looking for some great fast food in Vegas, make sure you pay a visit to Farm Basket.

I own a small business so I always try to support small businesses.   I have been in Las Vegas for 35 years...and the first place I went for chicken was Picnic n Chicken....now Farm Basket.  A lot has changed in Vegas over the past 35 years...mostly for the worse...Farm Basket, however, is consistently great food...reasonably priced with friendly service...I LOVE the gobbler turkey sandwich.

I liked it here! I got the Gobbler lunch special with a side of gravy. I slathered the sandwich with the cranberry sauce and miracle whip, and dipped it in the gravy... Total guilty pleasure. The gravy was a little bit bland, but overall it was a good lunch. 
I think this place is definitely worth trying. Just keep your expectations a little low. It's not the most amazing chicken I've ever had (Chick Fil A has my heart there), but if you're looking for a fun lunch, this is a good spot.

Just got some food from this location, I have been going to Farm Basket for a long time, thought I would stop by since I hadn't eaten there in quite a while. I ordered a super clucker. The chicken was like a piece of rubber, it was so disgusting. You could tell that it had either spent too much time in the freezer, or it was just neglected product, I don't know what was wrong with it, I was so hungry I tried to eat my whole sandwich, but I just couldn't do it. Will more than likely not return to this location. For a small chicken sandwich and a small side of macaroni and a drink I paid $10.16, I could get much better quality food at a different location for a lower price, will probably never eat there again.

I haven't eatin here in about 10 years so when Groupon had a special for it I had to go back . It is a small shack of a restaurant with a small dining area and drive through . The gentleman that took my order was nice and I told him it had been forever since I was there . He said that in the past they used frozen chicken , but now everyday is freshly made and breaded . I got the super finger meal and for my son the clucker sandwich . They were both very good and the breading was light and not greasy like other places . I will go back again for the fried chicken since everyone talks about it .

This place takes me back almost 40 years ago when I was 17 and eating at Farm Basket. Their clucketos are AMAZING! I could eat them all day. And I like the spice they put on their fries.

Only problem is they closed the SE location (insert sad panda face) and now the only one open is clear across town. I don't get to stop in often but when I am on that side of town a visit to Farm Basket is definitely on the list. I like their Clucker sandwich too, but I'm a sucker for an order of Clucketos and Fries. 

Used to sneak off to this place when I was in HS and my friends and I would order gravy and fries. Yummmmmmmm! Not that good for you, but taste incredible. 

I highly recommend Farm Basket and just wish we had one closer to me!!!!

Well I'm always looking for good chicken all the time. Let's start with the chicken it's like having original KFC with favor. Won't be ordering that again.  Also had Cluck e tos ( 3 rolled chicken tacos in a fried corn tortilla like taquitos with lettuce and cheese) not bad. I would order again. Got plain old fries (nice and hot). I will come back if I'm driving west on Charleston.  Need to critique a couple more items on the menu, so I will come back.
I like their chicken. They make it in all forms. I always have the cluck 'e' tos. (Chicken tacos) They are amazing. Fast service and always very clean.
very good fried chicken and the glazed rolls,mash potatoes and gravy are very good as well

This place is small and seems to get busy during the lunch hour. I got a 5 finger combo which was more food than I could finish and it was like a ghetto Cane's lol. You get a ton of food here for cheap as long as you don't mind eating in a tiny little shack. I would come back here because the fingers were nice and juicy although the fries were meh. They also have a drive thru.
Down to the last Farm Basket in town.  Always a great meal and great memories.
The clucker was delicious nothing special but still delicious and the fries are decent. A little pricy but you won't be dissapointed with the food.

When I was little, we went to Farm Basket ALOT. Now that I've moved out of Vegas, it's something I dream about from time to time. My absolute favorite thing is the Great Gobbler sandwich. It's a fried turkey breast on a roll with Miracle Whip (I always ask for extra) and cranberry sauce (YUM!). The fried chicken comes with a sweet orange roll that makes you want to lick all the glaze off your fingers when you're done. The gravy is so awesome I could drink it. It's definitely a local's place. My dad LOVES the Cluck-e-Tos but I've never tried them. Oh now I'm craving a gobbler......

Farm Basket is probably not the cleanest place in the world to eat. In fact, a few insects from inside the restaurant attached themselves to my wife as we were leaving. This place is a grimy and greasy!  My son's head smelled like fried chicken for the rest of the day.  That being said, I didn't want to wash his hair- because I liked it!

No joke, this place is great!   For lunch, I chose the 2 piece fried chicken meal (white meat) with mashed potatoes, gravy, and a delicious roll. The chicken was so juicy and seasoned perfectly. Translation - no salt or pepper needed, which is usually the first thing I do to fried chicken. I usually don't like using my hands to eat food, but I had no choice with this chicken. I felt like a fork and knife would have slowed down my eating process.  Instead, I shoved that chicken in my face and made all kinds of embarrassing animal noises until there was no meat left on 'dem bones. 

My wife opted for the cluck-e-tos, which were chicken taquitos with lettuce, cheese, and salsa. I was able to sneak a bit of these crunchy delights while keeping an eye on my chicken to make it wasn't going anywhere.  I have always associated taquitos with those frozen things that come in a 96-pack at Costco. This experience has made me a believer in this Americanized appetizer. The only thing that would make these better would be guacamole. (I'll trade the lettuce in for guacamole any day)

My kids tried the chicken fingers which I rank third on the list of menu items. The chicken wasn't nearly as tender as the fried chicken, and was not anything special to yelp about.  Oh, I almost forgot to mention those incredible French fries. These thin cut fries were cooked perfectly, and had just the right amount of seasoning. In fact, next time I will sub out the mashed potatoes for the fries instead. 

The staff was super friendly, and the food came out really fast. However, the dining area is small, and is not wheelchair accessible. All 6 of us were crammed into the back corner trying our best to not kick each other under the table.  But, with food this good - I can put up with it.  I won't go anywhere else for chicken--EVER!

This place has the best turkey sandwich in town.  There used to be 4 or 5 in town now there is only this one.  Have Bern eating the Cobbler sandwich for 30 years.  Always wonderfully tender turkey, great bun and tasty fries. Wish the one on Tropicana and Eastern was still around. Stop by and have a great Gobbler!

One of my favorite local places to eat! The clucker is one of my favorite chicken sandwiches of all time. Definetly check out this local gem no matter what side of town you live on. Don't judge the place from the outside, like most things it's what's inside that counts.
A horrible waste of money, fries were hard, greasy and broken. The "crunchy" chicken was more "crunch" than chicken. Awful, greasy and hard.

Farm Basket is one of those nostalgic treats I allow myself from time to time, but not too regularly.  The reason?  It's SO greasy.  And more than that, the grease is GOOD.  I don't know what they do to it or if I've just become acclimated to it over the years, but an order of fries from this place sends my taste buds tappin' but the rest of my gastrointestinal system into severe distress.  But man are they ever good.

The Gobbler is awesome.  A breaded turkey sandwich with Miracle Whip (hey, that's what they give you) and cranberry spread, it's just darn delicious.  The Clucketos are classics, and if you find yourself dipping into the Colonel's bucket too often, you should try some of their fried chicken on for size.  It'll win you over.

Plus, you get to drive through a barn.  That rules.

Just picked up your order what it was in complete with a half hour away from farm basket call and talk to Yvonne the manager can you bring it back no we can't bring it back I live 30 minutes from you no help with her the manager is not what I ordered

Dont let anyone tell you different, the chicken, chicken fingers and fries, along with BBQ and honey mustard are all unhealthy foods are of the gods, this is the last bastion of hope for good fast food in las vegas and i wont let it die,keep farm basket alive, i am a HUGE food fan, and this place will always win a place in my heart, its worth a shot, even once if you're in town, try it, im a local and i will ALWAYS go here just for a side of fresh fries, hands down best fries in town, keep it up farm basket, you are the best!!!!!!!

This was my first job, back when it was called picnic-n-chicken and the recipes are awesome still. The fresh baked goodies have pulled back a bit with the gradual downsizing, which is understandable. C'mon Steve, pm me, we gotta explore a way to re-emerge this brand before it takes its last breath and a great fresh food icon is gone. My eighteen year old goes gaga when we head there for a gobbler sandwich, fries, and the mashed potatoes covered with fresh crackling gravy, and the chicken is fantastic.

I debated on 2 stars or 3 stars but decided on 3 because it was my first visit and maybe It was just a bad day. 
I ordered the Gobbler and the Farm Fries. 
The Farm Fries were hot and loaded with cheese and gravy. Maybe a bit too much gravy but that's nothing to cry over. 
Where it all want wrong was the gobbler. It was just a boring puece of deep fried chicken on a bun. It was either sitting out too long or overcooked (or both ) because it was really dry and chewy. The only way I could finish it was to remove the bun and just eat the chicken, though I ended up feeding half to my dog.
FYI, the dog had no complaints.

One word.  Delicious!  From the outside ambiance to the area of town this place is in one would be a little apprehensive when considering whether to eat at this old school place.  Having not eaten here in over 15 years we decided to swing by their drive-thru tonight.  I am questioning now why we waited so long!!!  We drove 8 miles to get here. It's worth the "drive".  If you're not from Vegas and staying at a hotel I would still suggest making the "trek" to Farm Basket.  The service at the drive-thru was efficient and the girl was quite friendly and pleasant.  

The chicken was incredibly juicy, not greasy and tasted SO good.  Not overly spiced like other fast food fried chicken places.  The mashed potatoes are perfect as is the home style gravy.  Their rolls are tasty and fresh and the turkey sandwich with miracle whip and cranberry sauce is an awesome combination.  We didn't try the salads but I am sure they are good considering everything else was stellar.  They have pasta salad, potato salad and coleslaw.

As an added treat it was "buy one get one free" day for cluckeetos!  Better than any taquito you may have had at some Mexican restaurants.  They are crispy and filled with their great chicken.  Seems like a random item to have at a fried chicken spot.  I'm telling you, GET AN ORDER OF CLUCKEETOS AS AN APPETIZER IF NOTHING ELSE!   I will say they gypped us on one cluckeeto.  It's ok this one time as we were stuffed anyway.  Had that been my only item ordered I would be a little irate:-p.

We give this place 2 thumbs up!  We will be eating here within the next week or so.

Have lived in Vegas all of my life and this is one of my favorite spots.  It is a great little secret for amazing food and great service.  Has that old school feel.  Some of my friends call it a "hole in the wall" but we all love the food.  

I always get the Great Gobbler combo anytime that I am in the area.

The best chicken soup ever. It's a fried chicken place, good chicken too, btw.
And really good hot rolls, slathered in butter & honey, yum...
Not a spot that I would have pulled in tp, kinda divey. Had a Groupon though.
Had the Cluck ee tos five piece order with hot salsa.  The trick is to heat up the cheese covered cluck ee tos and remove the shredding lettuce.  It's awesome this way - try it!

Outdated decor, bathroom clearly not intended for the public, but the place to go if you're having a hankering for some fried chicken! Tasty and ample breading, hot and juicy chicken. Value priced, we'll be back next time we're in Vegas.

Had a groupon  I had purchased a while ago and needed use soon before it expired. It was for the 12 piece family meal. Not bad at all!  The service was quick walked in and out in less than 10 mins! Food was great even though I had to drive another 20-25 minutes home before I was able to enjoy the fried chicken! Definitely coming back some time later on or if and when they have another groupon!

Lived in LV for 15 years and always have heard this place is great - finally stopped and tried.  We got the Clucker & mashed potatoes w/gravy.
The sandwich was crispy but not tasty.
The mashed potatoes were instant and gravy was bland - I was very surprised.  Maybe it was just an off day.

So these guys have been here forever I heard. After coming here, WHY is my question.

First of all, I was looking for a chicken combo meal. You know, a couple pieces of chicken, fries, and a drink. Let's see.......you can have a sandwich combo, a chicken finger combo, and a clucketo combo. They have a chicken combo but it does not come with a drink. That's not really a combo dude! 

So after looking around the place, I noticed everybody that was eating didn't have any actual chicken on their plates. All I saw were chicken fingers, sandwiches, and clucketos (chicken taquitos). As if that wasn't enough of  a clue that the chicken wasn't good. 

So I opted for the Gobbler Combo, which is a turkey sandwich. The turkey itself is a breaded patty and deep fried. They give you a small package of mayo to flavor it, which I thought sorely needed it. The fries it came with were dry and covered with a lot of salt. Sadly, it could not save those poor potato sticks. 

After forcing myself to eat the turkey sandwich, against my better judgement, I actually wanted to try their chicken so I got a leg and a wing. Might as well have been a piece of rubber and styrofoam. 

Service was mysteriously fast. After further observation, it looks like they cook everything in advance and put it under warmers. I know this because not one second has passed since I hand over my debit card, they have one of the cooks handing me the two pieces of cardboard......err I mean chicken in a bag. I literally saw him pulling the chicken out of the warmer. 

So after taking a bite which should have been a nibble, I was afraid it was gonna bite me back. I would not give this stuff to a starving homeless person. That would be considered an insult. 

So to the reader, please, PLEASE DO NOT EAT HERE. To the owner, since you have been there forever, I assume you got nothing to worry about since you got some people to actually come back and eat here.
Best fried chicken and fried turkey sandwiches in Vegas! Been coming here my whole life, and I hope it never closes!

When you're eating here, you need a cap and gown, and it's not because you got awarded with a great meal, but something closer to your first meal after surgery.   

I had a such high expectations of this place because some reviewer told everyone on Flavor Flav review that Harold's Chicken (which closed down) and Farm Basket had a better fried chicken.   So I decided to try this place out, instead of getting a refill of a KoMex's Sunday religious experience.        

I pulled into this location, and there was three table filled with customers, but none of them were eating Fried Chicken.    Something not right,  I see a few Chicken fingers plates, a Mexican salad, a turkey plate, and a bunch of chicken sandwiches (which I heard is one of their specialty)  but no fried chicken.     At that point, I should have left, but I was determined to see it  that guy was correct.     

The menu is pretty simple, but I ordered the dinner plate which consisted of three pieces, Mashed potatoes and gravy, and some roll with some kind of sweet sauce on top of it.    I sat down, but my order was up in 90 seconds.   I was surprised at the speed of my order, but it was painful to eat this darn meal.    My experience was closer to getting a meal in the hospital when you're on a lot of  painkillers, and temporary lost most of your taste buds.    The chicken was pretty dry, and warm.   The Cole slaw had about 1cc of vinegar, and even less mayo.   The mash potatoes wasn't bad, but can you really blow pre-made potatoes?   

I'm not a monster fan of this place, and I'm wondering how the heck they stayed in business for so long?    Perhaps, it's all about the Sammie sandwich at this place because I seen more of those getting hammered than anything else.     Well, I  will give this place a chance again for one of their sandwich.     Perhaps, the stars will star to rise for the Farm Basket from me.
Farm basket is one of the better chicken fast food restaurants. The chicken, rolls and fries are simply to die for. If you want good and tasty chicken, then you really need to check out Farm Basket!!

This is Las Vegas' version of KFC. It has been part of the city (and when they were in CA) for nearly 40 years. They use to have at least 4 sites in town, but are now down to one. Most of the menu items are the same menu from the 80s, and still as good as it was back then.   This is a small business that is worth supporting.

The best chicken and fries in Vegas. I absolutely love farm basket the staff is very friends the place is always very clean and the food is always nice and warm and fresh I eat this place at least 5 times a month and I've never been disappointed it's so yummy! I just wish the had gift cards
i love this place!!! they have the best food!!! chick fil a is nothing compared to this place!!!love love love this place!!!
I have been coming here since I was a little girl & I absolutely love this place!! Greasy chicken and gravy....definitely not diet food, but worth the extra time on the treadmill.

I don't understand how anyone can love this place. We've been wanting to try it and finally had the opportunity. This place really is a step above (barely) KFC.  Hell, Popeyes is far superior to Farm Basket. The chicken is dry (and that was the dark meat), mashed potatoes and gravy very bland and kind of gross, and I don't know what the deal is with the bun they give you, but it's definitely not finger licking deliciousness worthy of how other people have described it. Gross as well. Bread was dry and cold   And the coleslaw was the worst I've ever tasted. My husband and I just sat there looking at each other, in complete disbelief, because we couldn't finish the food. We have never in our lives been ones to waste food and throw it away, but we literally took about two or three bites of everything and we're totally grossed out. You have to understand, my husband is from the Midwest. He would NEVER turn down chicken and ESPECIALLY mashed potatoes and gravy. He'd say, "yeah, I've had better, but I'm not going to let it go to waste". He literally could not eat it. I'm very saddened that our experience turned out this way because we had been wanting to go there for a very long time. It's not even a good fattening kind of meal. If you want that stay with KFC or Popeyes, or get the Broaster Chicken at Streets of New York. Even the employees are annoying. Just typical teenagers that can't be bothered with anything-which really fries me. Do yourself a favor and just skip this place. Totally not worth it.

I strongly recommend the Farm Fries, a basket of thin-cut (McDonald's style) fries bathed in gravy (turkey?) and melted yellow shredded cheese. The richness of the gravy was on point and not overwhelming. It was a savory, calorie-laden treat. 
I read a review that the Gobbler was right up there with a Bobbie (my most favorite sandwich). After having one on this visit, I must disagree. The hunk of fried turkey was cooked well. Did I enjoy the flavor? Not really. I didn't detect any seasoning in the batter. The bun was smaller than I expected for a $5.99 price tag. I also fail to see the point of not dressing the sandwich. The cranberry and Miracle Whip would be better served on the Gobbler rather than in packets on the side. 
Farm Basket, I gave you a whirl, I enjoyed your fries but I'm sticking with Capriotti's for my turkey sandwiches.

This place is a good little fried chicken spot.  I went here on a sunday and it was packed.  I had the chicken strips and they weren't great but they were hot and fried fresh.  The fries were awesome.  I want to go back and try the regular fried chicken, it looked pretty good, i bet i will upgrade there rating after I try that.

Visited Farm Basket on a weekday afternoon via drive-thru.

Atmosphere: Naturally Country
With a name like "Farm Basket", one would only expect a countryside-like feel of this facility. The architecture definitely brings out that feeling.

Service: Not bad
I went through the drive-thru, asked, "So what's good?" obviously referring to the menu since the preceding question from the cashier was asking me for my order.

As a reply, she said, "Farm Basket!" with a cheerful laugh. Kinda corny of a response: caught me off-guard for sure.

Food came out in a timely fashion.

Food: Not bad at all!
The chicken was quite juicy and had a good crunch. the potatoes were fluffy but did not have a real distinct flavor to them. The bread and coleslaw were nice, but nothing special stood out to them. I was full at the end of my meal, however. The price I paid for the meal was a decent, value, however.

Summary: A good stop for a quick and hearty meal
Despite the lack of individuality the food has, it's actually quite filling after consumption. Stop by for a hearty meal that will fill you up!

This place is a hit or miss. I got a 2 piece snack, my wing was super dry and hard, but my thigh was nice n fresh. Guess that's what I get from coming 10 minutes before closing. The Staff always has a smile on their face. Nice place for quick lunch. I enjoy there chicken fingers as well, I just have to request them to be well done crispy.

I hadn't been to Farm Basket in years but finally decided to drop in for a Turkey Gobbler sandwich and some chicken fingers. I gotta say it lived up to the memories of when I had it before and I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. Along with the Gobbler I got some fries and they were awesome with the right amount of crispy and seasoning. The customer service was great- very friendly and quick with it. I'll make it a point to stop in more regularly!

This place is a gem  I always ask people if they have been here and they always say no but I pass it up all the time. What a shame. I always tell them to go. Food is amazing best chicken beside churches. Love the Farm Fries.

This is a nostalgic place for many people who grew up in Las Vegas. It is pricey for "fast food",  but I never second guess visiting. The clucketos with cheese only are my go to, with the perfectly seasoned fries. The clucker and the sweet rolls are also very good. It's an institution in the neighborhood and I hope this one never goes away.

Farm Basket chicken was good but  not good enough to travel for the experience. There are other places closer to home that give the edge. There are about six booths in the restaurant. Outside patio seating is also available. 
Orders are place at the counter and you pick it up when ready. The wait time was very short. We ordered the six piece Family Basket (extra crispy) which comes with two rolls, two mashed potatoes and two coleslaw. We requested two additional coleslaw in place of mash potatoes.
We received a combination of white and dark meat although I did request white meat.  The chicken is very crunchy, a bit much for me. The meat was tasty but the breasts were a little dry. The coleslaw was basic and enjoyable. 
There are no washrooms which would be nice for washing hands. In place they should include hand wipes.

What happened. Been going here for sometime. Now, the employees are rude, The drive through sign is broken, and the chicken is slimy all the way thru. I cannot see this restaurant staying open for too much longer with their current situation.
Finally tried this place got a to go order food was nasty  family thought so as well mashed potatoes where disgusting chicken had no flavor glad it was a Groupon never going back :D

I love clucketoes!!! I grew up in Vegas right by the location on Maryland Pky. Clucketoes and the gobbler sandwich are my favorites. I usually don't order anything else. After 35 years I guess you know what you like.

Fabulous customer service!! Hands down the best chicken sandwiches in town 
Friendly staff makes your visit that much more enjoyable

I almost didn't go here because of some of the reviews I saw, which would have been a mistake.  

Don't go expecting 5-star cuisine and you won't be disappointed.  

This place is everything a fried chicken joint is supposed to be: fast, greasy, unhealthy, tasty, and affordable.  Okay, so one or two people found a hair in their fried chicken...  Is that the worst thing in the world?  No.  I assure you, even Bobby Flay's perfectly gelled hairs sometimes end up in the world class cuisine he's cooking.  Unfortunately, we live in a world where one mishap like that can wind up on a rating site like this and torpedo a solid business.  

Bottom line: this is a solid meal.  I picked the food up at the place and it was clean with an open kitchen, and the staff was friendly.  

Do not be deterred by the bad reviews and adjust your expectations accordingly.  
Enjoy!
This place is the best!!! So sad that it is the last one in town, anytime I'm on this side of town I make sure to stop.

HIGHLY Recommended. This is an old-school favorite and our family. We absolutely love everything on this menu. Everything is perfectly cooked, we love the little atmosphere down to every detail. The sodas fresh, the food is fresh we have never had a bad experience here. We wish that they would have more locations especially on the south side of the valley. If you haven't tried the clicker The rolled tacos and the gobbler, you have not lived. You have no idea what you're missing.

I just absolutely love their gobbler (turkey) or clucker (chicken) sandwiches!  With an order of clucketoes (rolled chicken tacos).  Soooo good!  I would recommend this fast food joint to anyone and everyone that visits Vegas!

This place has the best fried chicken, chicken sandwiches, and fries I've ever had!! I might eat fries twice a year, but these fries I would eat every week if I lived nearby. Don't let the outside appearance fool you, go in and order up! The inside looks as if you stepped back in time. I love that! Anytime I drive through Las Vegas you can be sure I'll stop by Farm Basket!!

I love this chicken joint!  The only disappointment in this place is its so far from where we live and it's the only one in town. The chicken, mayonnaise and cranberry is the bomb!  The drive thru is a tight squeeze coming in and out but when the food hrs my taste buds I forget about the drive and the drive thru.  That's all I have to say about that.

If you count when it was originally called Picnic 'N Chicken, Farm Basket has been in business over 40 years. We got our first Farm Basket in 1977 and while the original location on Tropicana is gone you can still find this one on West Charleston. Steve, the owner can be found most days behind the counter with a huge smile ready to serve customers. Bless Steve and his wife's (apart of the original family of owners) heart for keeping Farm Basket fresh, local and delicious all of these years. So many things come and go here in Vegas, so the fact that Steve is still doing it right after all these decades with very little change is truly awesome. Don't come here expecting fancy decor or anything modern looking. The business gives the appearance of a barn on the outside and inside has an old school western vibe that's very simple with no frills or gimmicky stuff. Ask sometime you are inside about some of he decor and you will find out that most of it has special meaning to the owners and is a nod to them. There is seating inside and they also have a covered patio with seating. During lunch and dinner time this place can get cramped with customers however the line moves quick. There is also a drive-thru which is very convenient. The number one seller here is the "Great Gobbler" that is a breaded turkey beast with cranberry sauce and Miracle Whip (don't even try to ask for mayo on this one!) and it's worth trying at least once if you never have before. Customer service is top notch here. 

Cluck e' tos ($4.99) - Something worth noting is that these are BOGO every Sunday! These are rolled chicken tacos with cheese, lettuce and salsa on the top. I have had plenty of rolled tacos from other places and there's something unique about how these ones taste. I like them a lot and when  Sunday rolls around it's hard to pass up. 

2 Piece Lunch ($5.99) - This comes with 2 pieces of fried chicken (your choice of original or crispy), mashed potatoes and gravy, coleslaw and a sweet orange roll. I always chose the original fried chicken because I just prefer it. The chicken is tender and flavorful. The mashed potatoes have a nice buttery flavor and the gravy, made from scratch, is really good. Coleslaw tastes fresh yet could use a little more flavor. If you don't like sweet things then tell them you want a plain roll with your meal or it will come with a sweet orange glaze on it. I personally like the sweet orange glaze, but wish the roll was served warm. 

Farm Fries ($3.99) - This is a generous portion for the price and can be easily shared with someone. You get a pile of fries smothered in homemade gravy and shredded cheese. Need I really mention more? Comforting and tasty!

They offer different specials each week and most of them including "Wacky Word" Wednesday are posted on their Facebook page.

Why 5 stars? You wouldn't have to ask that question if you have lived in Las Vegas for over thirty years.

But in case you haven't, you need to understand that this was at one point THE fast-food chicken restaurant to go to. Before the Colonel and his Kentucky-fried chicken took over much of the market, there was a Farm Basket in every corner of the town. Now there is one. 

I thought they were out of business. Nope. Found it today, ate there, remembered why I love it so much. 

For our visitors, those who have travelled here for business and/or pleasure, and you are looking for a culinary expedition, try this place out.

+They have good brewed iced tea.
+The Gobbler is real turkey breast.
+Real giblet gravy.
+Friendly service.

-My turkey was overcooked & not juicy.
-Nothing was salty enough
-No drink refills

I wanted to love the place.  I'm glad I tried it, but I don't think I'll be back.

This weekend a large group of us, 40 people visited the restaurant while we were on a scavenger hunt with a car group event.  We had to wait about an hour for one of our team members came with a chicken suit for a picture we wanted to take in front.  While we waited we all ordered food and drinks which were delicious.  The owner let us block his drive thru for 5 minutes to take our picture and thru all of our commotion, the owner and employees were friendly, accommodating and fun!  The owner even got in our picture with us!  At the end of our scavenger hunt, which we won, we believe the picture got us the win!  
Thank you Farm Basket!  From the Shelby Car Club!

I love Farm Basket! They seriously have the best fast food fried chicken. I tried this place about a year ago because I had a groupon and I keep coming back. I usually get the fried chicken dinner with roles, mashed potatoes, and French fries but today when we went through the drive thru. I ordered the chicken fingers meal. Omg it was amazing! Crispy chicken strips, juicy not greasy and it was all white meat chicken. The honey mustard sauce was awesome as well. I also ordered for the first time there cheesy fries. They were so good I didn't want to share! Shoe string French fries with gravy and cheese. I was in carb heaven! And I'm usually not a gravy person. This place is amazing I would recommend to go here when you're having a craving for fried chicken.
I liked the feel but the food was really bland and honestly remind of cafeteria food. And made me feel sick

I waited 15 minutes for a "Clucker."  Let me reemphasize that, I waited 15 minutes for a breaded, deep fried chicken patty that came with Miracle Whip and a side of cranberry jelly.  It wasn't even that good.  That's what I get for listening to a recommendation from a guy who thinks Japanese food is gross.  

I may go back to try the fried chicken.
This is barely a step above KFC (actually I take that back, I've had better KFC), chicken was meh, mashed potatoes were worse and the gravy was inedible. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
This place has not changed in 20 years.  Turkey steak dinner fries instead of slaw.  Sometimes you just crave it.   Great food nice owner.  Oldie but goodie.

Old school, tasty food. Anytime I find myself near Charleston and Jones I have to stop by, even if not hungry. This is your parents version of fast food and takes me back to the late 80s early 90s in my mind. Everyone I take here rolls their eyes at first then later want to come back. Wish this wasn't the only 1 left but hopefully it isn't going anywhere

Pros- good portions, mashed potatoes and gravy are awesome, Great Gobbler turkey sandwich is a must have. Courteous fast service
Cons- prices can be a bit high for most considering its fast food, I have never liked cluck ee tos and am convinced they only sell because the clever silly name

I have been going to Farm Basket since I was a kid! I LOVE it!! The cluckee is my fav sandwich & farm fries are amazing!! But you must try the fries without gravy 1st so you can taste just how delicious they are! Best fries ever!!!

Love farm basket. They have the best chicken ever. Its very moist an good. I love the clucketos as well. With the cheese an lettuce an yoir choice of salsa it's great. Great mashed potatoes and gravy as well as the swwwt butter rolls. Its always a great quick dinner that you can kust drive thru an get. An tbe prices are well worth it.

I have been going to Farm Basket since I could remember.  I have always been a fan of their Super Clucker sandwich... they make their chicken fresh several times a day from fresh chicken..not frozen. . .I also like their Cluck e toes... these are chicken rolled tacos with cheese and lettuce and salsa... On Sundays they offer these "buy one get one free"...i'm always a sucker for this deal... The french fries always taste great when fresh and hot because they use a unique seasoning.  This is the only location in town anymore and I will eat here at least once a month.  It has changed a lot over the years...especially pricing... but it's to be expected considering it's the only location they have.. i love their fried chicken... it always tastes great... and i love their diet skinny chicken...which is where they strip the skin off and still flour and fry the chicken... their chicken is pressure fried... and i think this is how they keep it moist inside... my favorite thing here is the Pepsi... i hate soda... and definitely am not a true fan of Pepsi... but the Pepsi at this location has to be the best Pepsi I have ever tasted in my life... and it's fountain soda... which i'm not even a fan of! Don't go here expecting cuisine or anything.. it is still a fast food location... but it is a taste of my childhood and if you ask anyone who grew up in Vegas... they all love Farm Basket!

I do not have nostalgic memories to inflate my rating of this business, being that I neither 'grew up' on Farm Basket (I imagine I would not be as strong and healthy if I had) nor even ever heard of them in any way before stepping in to the lone remaining area establishment on account of needing calories FAST. 

PRO: The calories are indeed delivered to you fast. Seriously no more than two minutes after stepping through the open doorway I had my food in a tiny white bag -- seeping grease from it in various spots -- in my hand and on my way. 

CON: The food provided was grossly over*priced as well as fairly unimpressive. If you are going to charge Chick-Fil-A or Raising Cane's prices, I expect it to be close to the same quality (minus the unabashed homophobia and Jesus music playing in the case of CFA).

PRO: They are a non-chain business (?) in a world of chains galore. 

CON: They won't be an any-type of business if they keep salting their fries so heavily that they will single-handedly kill all of their loyal clientele. My blood pressure might have tripled succeeding eating my small fries, which had more salt on them than I have had in months, combined.

Conclusion: Their tagline is "We're Carried Away With Quality"; the truth is that they are carried away with their use of salt. Do not recommend unless you are suffering from dilutional hyponatremia. - E

Had farm basket once almost 5 years ago and remember it being a good experience. Just picked up an order of clucke'tos with fries and a chicken sandwich. The sandwich had to be several hours old, because it was so dry and the texture was terrible. Could not finish it and tossed it. My fries weren't fresh either. Two stars, because the clucke'tos were decent.

I come here all the time to get the Finger Meal Deal with fries, ranch sauce, and drink. Farm Basket fries are cooked in perfection (crispy and tasty) literally the best price I've ever had! This place will make you want to crave it again and again.

Got the chicken sandwich combo after reading reviews and this place is definitely overrated. The chicken was very bland and although the cranberry sauce and miracle whip helped, it was nothing to rave about. Save yourself the time and money, $10 was too much for the quality and quantity given.

Farm Basket has a lot of fond memories for me so I'm gonna nerd out a bit on this review.  I used to go there in the 80's while I was in High School and my meal of choice used to be a Gobbler and Fries.   I even took a marketing class in college with one of the owner's children and got a free Farm Basket meal once!  That was something worth bragging about, Free Farm Basket!  Alas, I moved out of the area but not too long ago, I took on a position where the office is not too far away and we have been reunited (and it feels so good)!

Best...Fries...Ever...  That's all I need to say, but it's not all I'm gonna say.  I'm more of a Clutkeetos (chicken taquitos) and fries person these days, but I can't go without those fries.  I commented on my facebook page about the reuniting and all sorts of my former classmates chimed in about their favorites and I didn't remember the "gravy fries" from before so had to try them.  I think I closed half an artery on that one, but perhaps worth it!  

I can't eat what I want to as much as I used to for health reasons, but I do need to stop here and assure I get my fix once in a while now days.  I'm glad to have rediscovered Farm Basket!

The food here is always fresh, made to order and very tasty. I have been enjoying farm basket for many years and love there clucketos and French fries which are seasoned just right. The employees are all friendly and greet you with a welcome smile ready to take your order. I definitely will be returning here to enjoy the chicken and sandwiches that are on the menu.

I've always loved this place since childhood! Even after going several years without it, it was just as good as I remembered. And obviously they have some of the best fries ever! Looking forward to the expansion to have one back on my side of town, hopefully!

The first time I ever went to Farm Basket was with my dad when I was a kid, and he had been introduced to Farm Basket by a family member when *he* was young. Now I am twenty-six and happy to show this place to anyone I can. This small, simple spot has been around for over forty years, and there's a good reason why: the food is consistently delicious and reliable. 

Much like the revered In-N-Out, the menu hasn't changed a whole lot over the years. After all, why fix something that isn't broken? Instead, they choose to stick to what they are good at--what they are great at. And that's turkey and chicken!

The family favorite in this house is The Gobbler sandwich. It's a simple piece of breaded and fried turkey cooked to juicy perfection on a soft roll. No muss, no fuss to let the turkey run the show! On the side automatically comes a small container of cranberry sauce and a package of Miracle Whip should you want to dress it up. It reminds me of making sandwiches out of Thanksgiving leftovers without any of the dried out sadness. Making it a meal adds a drink and a side of fries,  which are thin but golden and crispy and seasoned. They also have a chicken sandwiches and buckets of chicken available and a variety of sides. 

Come to Farm Basket if you want chicken and turkey done right. You can't survive in that business as long as they have if you don't. On Wednesdays they will offer a deal on one of their menu items if you come in and give them the code word they post on their Facebook page.

This place suceeds in spite of itself. 

It has a great location, and an appealing look. I wish I could say the same about the food. I agree with Jamie P's review; the food is not quality. 

If you're in the mood for this type of food, and don't feel like driving 90 miles to the nearest Chic Fil A, then settle for Raising Caine. You'll at least get hot food, quality fries, and a friendly attitude. 

I am done with this; one and out.

I'm glad I purchased a Groupon, and didn't pay full price.

The chicken was not good, the breading was really horrible and like, fat. 

The turkey sandwich was literally on 2 small rolls... I'm paying $7 for a turkey tender on 2 MFing rolls?! And to top it off, by the time I got home, the rolls were stuck onto the turkey because of the grease!

The fries tasted like the butter crap on the roll, because the guy just threw it in there last minute and it landed in the fries. Gross.

The roll was also not what I expected.

We ended up throwing away half of the food.

The cashier girl was nice, which is why I gave them 2 stars and it was fast.
Didn't know what to get, so just ordered chicken fingers and fries. It was good, not amazing. Would come back to try something different in the menu. Love that they have a drive thru!

Never go away Farm Basket! You are the last location and hope you guys open more back up. Your Great Gobbler and seasoned fries have cured my hang overs for years and I have the fondest memories growing up eating at your Desert Inn location... please open that one back up... love always.. Forever Farm Basket fan
This is a great little hole in the wall joint. I ordered the chicken plate. The chicken is very good, mash potatoes and gravy is excellent, and the chicken soup is very flavorful.

I actually really like this place. Alot of their stuff is greasy but if you aren't worried about dieting than this place is a good alternative to every other fast food joint out there. Their fries are really good. I love the great gobbler special. Never tried the cluckeetos, but i'll give that a try next time. Their chicken is also good to me. It's too bad they don't give free refills on drinks otherwise i'd give 5 stars. Greasy =great when it comes to this place.

Classic fast food restaurant in Las Vegas for decades.  It has survived for several reasons.  More of a 4.5, than a 5.  The Clucker and Gobbler are their signature items in my opinion
(My favorite the Clucker).  However, there are other various good menu items.

I have to say that we may stop coming here. We have been coming here a few times a month for years but they have changed stuff and not in a good way. They are now toasting the buns on the turkey sandwhich but they don't use real butter and what happens is it leaves an acrid taste that is not nice. The cranberry is now just a watery, thin jelly and they have gone cheap on the mayo. Cheap mayo has a strong flavor. Please go back to Kraft. 

They also made changes to the gravy on the potatoes and other things like baskets instead of plates (hard to assemble the sandwich in a narrow basket) and wooden forks (the jury is out on this one). We are afraid to try our other favorites as we were so disappointed in this.

Like most first timers, I got the Groupon and had the 12 piece meal. 
The chicken was actually not bad (some old pieces in the mix I think), all in all it should be pretty good as being the last Farm Basket in the world, so I was told. 
I liked the mashed potatoes and turkey gravy the most out of the meal though, the rolls with the butter lemony sauce was a treat also. Cole slaw was what to expect. 
Worth the Groupon, but I wouldn't go out of the way for it.

I have been eating at farm basket basically since I've had teeth! Perhaps that makes it somewhat nostalgic and that's why I gave it 5 stars, but really the food is EVERYTHING! the fries are one of a kind and they put BOMB seasoning on them. You don't go to farm basket for the chicken bucket tho! You have to get the cluckeetos (mild for better salsa) and fries or the Clucker sandwich and fries! Amazing. The clucker comes with miracle whip and cranberry sauce, two things I HATE... I watched my mom eat it for 20 years before I tried it myself because I hate them, but together, on the clucker, is soooooo good! I was stunned. ?Just eat here if you haven't!!!! IT is sad that this is the ONLY FARM BASKET IN THE WORLD! lol

7-29-16
Came for lunch.  The chicken was precooked like KFC not fresh.  Potatoes were slightly warm with hot gravy not much flavor.  I told them they were not hot and didn't got much response except they're warm.  I don't know about the lady working at 11Am but good thing I wasn't a food inspector. The back area to the bathroom was vary dirty Surprised they have an A rating
I'm not coming back there are to many other options with hot and fresh food guaranteed!!!
The only reason I gave a three star was the last time I was here it was good around 5pm.  Different workers with a blond girl that was friendly.  Today not cool!!!!
I see another business going down the tube soon

I have passed this place many times the 20 years I have lived in Las Vegas.  It's a hole in the wall, no curb appeal.  But, today I had a craving for fried chicken. KFC sucks, Smiths has ok fried chicken, but thought i would google fried chicken.  Great reviews for FB.  So I hopped in the car and ordered their 8 piece dark meat for $7.99

It is very good chicken.  Not the best i have ever had, (the best was in st Louis MO.) but good!  I went thru the drive thru, the employee was very nice and service was fast.  I'll return!

Since 2007, I have been proud to call Farm Basket on Charleston and Jones my ultimate chicken eatery.  There've been lots of chicken places I've eaten over the years from Roy Rogers to KFC, to Chick Fil-A to Raising Canes.   But quite honestly, the number place for me when I am in the mood for chicken is Farm Basket.  The place is small but comfortable.  The booth's are nice and long so you can stretch out a bit especially if you're there by yourself.  I almost always order the Finger Meal Deal with a Diet Pepsi and a small cup of their gravy instead of their usual dipping sauce options.

I didn't use to order their gravy when I first started eating there in 2007, but around 2010 or 2011, I tried it for the first time and oh...my...GOD IS IT THE BEST!!!!!!  I'll even dip my fries in it too!

I am one of those people who always knows exactly what they love when it comes to food so I'm unfortunately not one of those people who has tried everything on the menu.  But I can tell you that I have had both the Gobbler and the Clucker, and YES, there IS a difference! One's a turkey cutlet, the other's a chicken cutlet, but originally I could NOT tell the difference in taste!  The addition of Farm Fries to the menu is a nice version of Poutine in my opinion.  Their carrot cake is sometimes too big to finish even if you order a small size.  The gravy is to DIE FOR!  The chicken fingers...what I can tell you from coming here nearly 10 years, I know they've changed the recipe, and numerous times.  Back when I first started going in 2007, the chicken had somewhat of a softness to it and was a bit more salty.  Over the last 3 or 4 years, they have used less salt and the chicken is bit more on the tough side, but still edible and delicious.

I only wish that to show my love for this place they offered merchandise for the restaurant like baseball caps and t-shirts!

Keep up the great work Farm Basket! Here's to nearly 10 years of customer loyalty!

This Farm Basket has been the "once a year" treat I like to feast on at one point in the year. They salt the fries so perfectly and the chicken breast is really juicy. Man I am getting hungry just thinking of "the gobblers."

Bleah Ugh...puke Fast food. Ok so it's chicken...Mmmm But it's fast food chicken in a little hole in the wall place shaped like a barn. Uhm...ok farmers...get their chickens from chicken coops and yes...the occasional barn.  So I had the "gobbler" and a couple thighs from there. Ok turkey breast? Turkeys aren't that small...Chicken...Albertson's Fried Chicken was just as good if not better. But the snot nosed kid who tried to take my order and give me some small ass chicken just wasn't that bright. Ok ok yes Myke you're a jerk because at least he has a job and he's not stealing cars or in a gang...or better yet going door to door and selling giant candy.  So wanna know something special about this place that makes chicken worth coming back to...?  Ask Damon. Seriously. WHAT THE HELL IS a CLUCKEETO?

Have passed by this place many times and finally stopped in last night. Didn't expect much so we were not disappointed. It's a quaint little place, a few booths and the bathroom is outside. They have a drive thru too. So we ordered a clucker special and a 2 piece lunch. My husband loved his clucker sandwich. It was hot and juicy. Fries were average, but the bread was good too. I had the crispy fried chicken. Also hot and juicy. Good flavor. Mashed potatoes and gravy were good. Cole slaw was nothing to write home about. They put a sweet glaze on a huge roll that was a sweet surprise. All in all...the food was good. You should not go expecting a five star experiene; it's a little hole in the wall and it's perfectly imperfect.  The food is good so we will be back. Give it a try!
Amazing food ! Super sad this is the only one in town! Only complaint is it's hard to hear in the drivethu. Other than that I give this place 5 stars!!!

Farm Basket used to have many locations around the Vegas Valley, but with the Tropicana location losing its lease, this is the only one left.

Farm Basket is, essentially, a drive-thru restaurant specializing in poultry products. They have been around for decades, and had several locations in the Valley - if you see some sort of establishment around town shaped like a small barn, chances are a Farm Basket once occupied that property.

The food itself is very good, and filling. The portions are a good size - so good, in fact, that I have to order off of the kids menu and it's STILL often too much food (and they have no problem if you order off of it, regardless of age.) 

The menu itself is quite diverse, featuring a variety of poultry products. Want straight-up chicken fingers and fries? They've got that. But if you want something a little more exotic, they also have the Gobbler, which features real turkey, and their signature Cluck-E-Tos, which are essentially taquitos with poultry instead of meat/beef.

The big complaint I have is that they only have one location left, and it is not in a great part of town. This remaining location is near the West Charleston campus of College of Southern Nevada, so unless you're in that area, expect a long, painful commute to get here. 

All thongs considered, Farm Basket is delicious, it's just a shame they don't have the variety of locations they once did. If you're in the neighborhood, swing on in, but don't go out of your way for it.

Maybe you can't get Chick Fil- A in Vegas yet, but you can still get an awesome chicken sandwich at Farm Basket.  These babies haven't changed since I was a kid and they are awesome!  The clucketo's are also dee-lish!  It's a little pricey, but worth it.  Puts the other chain chicken sandwiches to shame!  There used to be several of these around town, but this is the only one I've seen in recent travels.  So, while rumors swirl over the possible arrival of Chick Fil-A, you can still sate your desire at Farm Basket while you wait!

A little expensive but the Cluckitoes are light and crispy, covered in cheese. Mmmm.... The Super Clucker and Great Gobbler are delicious as well.
 The fries are seasoned perfectly.
 Not sure what a child could order except the chicken finger meal.
 The owner will make sure everything is perfect when he's there, otherwise check your order. Small, only 6 tables inside, drive thru, small parking lot.
 No vegetarian choices, they do offer desserts, ask when you order a drink, some come in cans.   :/

I have been coming here my entire 21 years of life. Not once have I had a problem until today. The cook simply forgot to put the season salt on my fries. I returned to the counter and asked for a side of salt. The young women at the counter rolled her eyes at me and didn't believe the cook forgot the salt. Infront of me she had an argument with the cook about what I had said and said she didn't know what I was talking about. This young women needs customer service training. The cook fixed it in seconds and I could still hear her in the back round talking about the salt.

Got the "Gobbler Sandwich" ...batter taste like stuffing!!!!  Yummy.

My lady got the chicken strips combo.

Not bad.

15 mins from the strip.

This is childhood! 

If you are anyone of anyone of anyone who's from Vegas you know this is childhood! 

Hot damn this place is the best of the best! Forget KFC, Popeyes, and all those others this is flat out fabulous. Support you small businesses and keep them busy!!! 

Yum

Farm Basket? After eating here I thought I was headed towards a warm casket.

The fried chicken in the "family fried chicken dinner" I had was absolutely fried a day (or days) earlier and then thrown in the microwave. I've made the mistake of reheating leftover fried chicken in the microwave before and this was a reheat job. Never have I had such a thick, soggy coat of breading on a piece of fried chicken that slid off in a greasy mess in one wet disgusting piece. Thick and soggy...and tasteless! -And for comic relief, inside the meat was dry. Just the worst piece of fried chicken I ever had. I dare you to find an elementary school cafeteria that could produce worse. Even my girlfriend agreed, "wow, this is bad".

To elaborate on the rest of the meal...

The rolls were not fresh
The cole slaw was dry and tasteless
The fries were INSANELY over-salted

...and I've had better mashed potatoes lunchtime at a Chinese buffet.

I really hoped I could go far on yelp without tossing out a one-star rating (as I have a soft spot for business owners) but to be this out of touch with what you are handing out across the counter is ridiculous.

I might eat at a fried chicken joint twice a year, but with options such as Popeye's, KFC and Church's everywhere...how anyone can justify coming here is beyond me. 

I would love to dine with someone who gave this place 3 or more stars just to see how they could possibly feign a compliment on any level.

Sorry..tho Farm Basket used to be one of my favorite places to go eat..forget it now!  Ordered the Chicken Fingers..yukkkk!   The breading was pealing off and greasy disgusting as hell. Didnt take a pic cuz I was so yukked out..the fries didnt taste like chicken as they used to either..I met the owner once at a party and he said his fries were made with a special chicken flavor..not anymore tho..they didnt taste good and were greasy tasting..yukkkkkk..sorry guys get your act together!

THIS PLACE IS A CRIME!
